step1.sentence: The project faced serious funding cuts, but the team found ways to overcome the obstacles.

step2.story: She had overcome obstacles that would have stopped many people earlier in the process. What kept her moving was not optimism — she was not particularly optimistic — but a specific kind of stubbornness that refused to accept any individual obstacle as the final word.

step3.story: The study of people who overcame significant obstacles revealed a consistent pattern that researchers had not expected: most did not describe themselves as unusually resilient. They described themselves as having found one thing — one person, one skill, one reason — that made the obstacle feel surmountable rather than final. Resilience, in this framing, was less a character trait and more a structural advantage: access to something that made the next step possible. The intervention implications were significant.

meaning.realUsageKo: 어려움이나 방해물을 이겨내고 앞으로 나아갈 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: overcome은 come over(넘어오다)에서 발전한 표현으로, 장애물 위를 넘어서는 이미지입니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: surmount obstacles(더 격식체)와 유사하지만 overcome이 더 일반적으로 씁니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: She overcame every obstacle on the path to her goal.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그녀는 목표를 향한 길에서 모든 장애물을 극복했어요.
